## Government Tender: CSC Water Main Replacement, Prince Albert, Saskatchewan

**Reference Number**: PW-PWU-201-12305
**Solicitation Number**: EV385-230830/A
**Publication Date**: August 31, 2022
**Tender Closing Date**: September 20, 2022 at 1600 hours
**Trade Agreement**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
**Region of Opportunity**: Saskatchewan

**Project Description**: Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is seeking tenders for the provision of materials, equipment, labour, and supervision to supply and install a new domestic water supply main at the Correctional Services Canada (CSC) operated Saskatchewan Penitentiary in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

**Scope of Work**: The work includes:

- Supply and installation of approximately 500 meters of polymer piping in the existing utility tunnels to replace the existing domestic water supply distribution lines.
- Supply and installation of approximately 200 meters of polymer piping in the existing steam tunnels to replace the existing softened water supply distribution.
- Demolition of all existing systems to be replaced and removal of waste materials off-site.
- Start-up, commissioning, and training of all systems installed.
- Testing of the water service after completion.

**Mandatory Requirements**:

- Two (2) reference projects undertaken by the supplier within the last five years relating to domestic water supply main construction.
- Suppliers must demonstrate compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

**Evaluation Criteria**: The evaluation will consist of a two-phase process. The first phase will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers, and the second phase will invite qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project.

**Key Contact Information**:

- Hector Ho, PWGSC Supply Specialist
- Phone: 780-901-0989
- Email: [hector.ho@pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:hector.ho@pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Important Notes**:

- Please monitor Buyandsell.gc.ca for any changes to bid closing dates.
- Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
- The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers.
- The estimated value of the project is between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000.
